thread.title: Man dies after heroic efforts of bystanders who performed CPR in Wellington Harbour
thread.title_full: Man dies after heroic efforts of bystanders who performed CPR in Wellington Harbour

title: Man dies after heroic efforts of bystanders who performed CPR in Wellington Harbour
text:
Man dies after heroic efforts of bystanders who performed CPR in Wellington Harbour Last updated 19:44, February 5 2017 ERIC JANSSEN/STUFF.CO.NZ 
A Wellington man has been taken to hospital by the Life Flight helicopter after he was badly injured in Wellington harbour near Eastbourne. 
A man found seriously injured on a Wellington beach has died. 
The sound of screams alerted bystanders at an Eastbourne beach that something had gone horribly wrong in Wellington Harbour on Sunday afternoon. 
On a picture-perect summer's day, people rushed to the aid of a man, who police say was 30 years old. He had been badly injured on Sunday afternoon. One resident said the man had been kite-surfing. ERIC JANSSEN/FAIRFAX NZ 
A man was pulled from Wellington Harbour near Eastbourne. 
Wellington Free Ambulance's Di Livingstone said the emergency call was received about 3.45pm. She said the man's friends pulled him from the water and started CPR, with the help of "one of our call takers" until the paramedics and Fire Service arrived. 
He was taken by ambulance to the nearby Lifeflight rescue helicopter and flown to Wellington Hospital in a critical condition but died soon after arriving. 
Police said they were supporting the man's family at this sad time. 
Emergency services with the man on the beach. 
One witness, who did not want to be named, said he heard screaming and saw the man in trouble in the water. 
It was a tragic start to the day further north, where police confirmed that a diver had died during an outing, north of Gisborne. 
Emergency services were called out to remote Anaura Bay, near Tolaga Bay, about 9.50am on Sunday. 
Police said the man had surfaced from a dive at a spot near Hinetamatea Marae and after getting out of the water he collapsed. 
Despite the efforts of emergency services the man could not be revived. 
The man's death has been referred to the coroner. - Stuff
